color.description: Hex color code for the agent (e.g., #FF5733)

description.description: Description of when to use the agent

hidden.description: Hide this subagent from the @ autocomplete menu (default: false, only applies to mode: subagent)

steps.description: Maximum number of agentic iterations before forcing text-only response

$schema.description: JSON schema reference for configuration validation

autoshare.description: @deprecated Use 'share' field instead. Share newly created sessions automatically

autoupdate.description: Automatically update to the latest version. Set to true to auto-update, false to disable, or 'notify' to show update notifications

auto.description: Enable automatic compaction when context is full (default: true)

prune.description: Enable pruning of old tool outputs (default: true)

default_agent.description: Default agent to use when none is specified. Must be a primary agent. Falls back to 'build' if not set or if the specified agent is invalid.

disabled_providers.description: Disable providers that are loaded automatically

enabled_providers.description: When set, ONLY these providers will be enabled. All other providers will be ignored

chatMaxRetries.description: Number of retries for chat completions on failure

continue_loop_on_deny.description: Continue the agent loop when a tool call is denied

mcp_timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for model context protocol (MCP) requests

openTelemetry.description: Enable OpenTelemetry spans for AI SDK calls (using the 'experimental_telemetry' flag)

primary_tools.description: Tools that should only be available to primary agents.

instructions.description: Additional instruction files or patterns to include

model.description: Model to use in the format of provider/model, eg anthropic/claude-2

provider.description: Custom provider configurations and model overrides

share.description: Control sharing behavior:'manual' allows manual sharing via commands, 'auto' enables automatic sharing, 'disabled' disables all sharing

small_model.description: Small model to use for tasks like title generation in the format of provider/model

theme.description: Theme name to use for the interface

diff_style.description: Control diff rendering style: 'auto' adapts to terminal width, 'stacked' always shows single column

username.description: Custom username to display in conversations instead of system username

input_buffer_end.description: Move to end of buffer in input

input_buffer_home.description: Move to start of buffer in input

input_delete_to_line_end.description: Delete to end of line in input

input_delete_to_line_start.description: Delete to start of line in input

input_line_end.description: Move to end of line in input

input_line_home.description: Move to start of line in input

input_select_buffer_end.description: Select to end of buffer in input

input_select_buffer_home.description: Select to start of buffer in input

input_select_line_end.description: Select to end of line in input

input_select_line_home.description: Select to start of line in input

input_select_visual_line_end.description: Select to end of visual line in input

input_select_visual_line_home.description: Select to start of visual line in input

input_visual_line_end.description: Move to end of visual line in input

input_visual_line_home.description: Move to start of visual line in input

messages_half_page_down.description: Scroll messages down by half page

messages_half_page_up.description: Scroll messages up by half page

messages_line_down.description: Scroll messages down by one line

messages_line_up.description: Scroll messages up by one line

messages_page_down.description: Scroll messages down by one page

messages_page_up.description: Scroll messages up by one page

messages_toggle_conceal.description: Toggle code block concealment in messages

model_provider_list.description: Open provider list from model dialog

command.description: Command and arguments to run the MCP server

enabled.description: Enable or disable the MCP server on startup

environment.description: Environment variables to set when running the MCP server

timeout.description: Timeout in ms for MCP server requests. Defaults to 5000 (5 seconds) if not specified.

clientId.description: OAuth client ID. If not provided, dynamic client registration (RFC 7591) will be attempted.

clientSecret.description: OAuth client secret (if required by the authorization server)

scope.description: OAuth scopes to request during authorization

enabled.description: Enable or disable the MCP server on startup

headers.description: Headers to send with the request

oauth.description: OAuth authentication configuration for the MCP server. Set to false to disable OAuth auto-detection.

timeout.description: Timeout in ms for MCP server requests. Defaults to 5000 (5 seconds) if not specified.

url.description: URL of the remote MCP server

start.description: Startup script to run when creating a new workspace (worktree)

disabled.description: Disable this variant for the model

enterpriseUrl.description: GitHub Enterprise URL for copilot authentication

setCacheKey.description: Enable promptCacheKey for this provider (default false)

anyOf.description: Timeout in milliseconds for requests to this provider. Default is 300000 (5 minutes). Set to false to disable timeout.
Disable timeout for this provider entirely.

timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for requests to this provider. Default is 300000 (5 minutes). Set to false to disable timeout.

custom.description: Allow typing a custom answer (default: true)

ServerConfig.description: Server configuration for opencode serve and web commands

cors.description: Additional domains to allow for CORS

id.description: Unique identifier for the todo item

priority.description: Priority level of the task: high, medium, low

status.description: Current status of the task: pending, in_progress, completed, cancelled

startCommand.description: Additional startup script to run after the project's start command

get.description: Get a list of all available AI agents in the OpenCode system.
Get a list of all available commands in the OpenCode system.
Retrieve the current OpenCode configuration settings and preferences.

patch.description: Update OpenCode configuration settings and preferences.

get.description: Get a list of all configured AI providers and their default models.
Get events
Get all available MCP resources from connected servers. Optionally filter by name.
Get a list of available tools with their JSON schema parameters for a specific provider and model combination.
Get a list of all available tool IDs, including both built-in tools and dynamically registered tools.

delete.description: Remove a git worktree and delete its branch.

get.description: List all sandbox worktrees for the current project.

post.description: Create a new git worktree for the current project and run any configured startup scripts.
Reset a worktree branch to the primary default branch.

get.description: List files and directories in a specified path.
Read the content of a specified file.
Get the git status of all files in the project.
Search for text patterns across files in the project using ripgrep.
Search for files or directories by name or pattern in the project directory.
Search for workspace symbols like functions, classes, and variables using LSP.
Get formatter status
Retrieve the current global OpenCode configuration settings and preferences.

patch.description: Update global OpenCode configuration settings and preferences.

post.description: Clean up and dispose all OpenCode instances, releasing all resources.

get.description: Subscribe to global events from the OpenCode system using server-sent events.
Get health information about the OpenCode server.

post.description: Clean up and dispose the current OpenCode instance, releasing all resources.
Write a log entry to the server logs with specified level and metadata.

extra.description: Additional metadata for the log entry

service.description: Service name for the log entry

get.description: Get LSP server status
Get the status of all Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

post.description: Dynamically add a new Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to the system.

delete.description: Remove OAuth credentials for an MCP server

post.description: Start OAuth authentication flow for a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server.

authorizationUrl.description: URL to open in browser for authorization

post.description: Start OAuth flow and wait for callback (opens browser)
Complete OAuth authentication for a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server using the authorization code.
Connect an MCP server
Disconnect an MCP server

get.description: Retrieve the current working directory and related path information for the OpenCode instance.
Get all pending permission requests across all sessions.

post.description: Approve or deny a permission request from the AI assistant.

get.description: Get a list of projects that have been opened with OpenCode.
Retrieve the currently active project that OpenCode is working with.

patch.description: Update project properties such as name, icon, and commands.

start.description: Startup script to run when creating a new workspace (worktree)

get.description: Get a list of all available AI providers, including both available and connected ones.
Retrieve available authentication methods for all AI providers.

post.description: Initiate OAuth authorization for a specific AI provider to get an authorization URL.
Handle the OAuth callback from a provider after user authorization.

get.description: Get a list of all active pseudo-terminal (PTY) sessions managed by OpenCode.

post.description: Create a new pseudo-terminal (PTY) session for running shell commands and processes.

delete.description: Remove and terminate a specific pseudo-terminal (PTY) session.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific pseudo-terminal (PTY) session.

put.description: Update properties of an existing pseudo-terminal (PTY) session.

get.description: Establish a WebSocket connection to interact with a pseudo-terminal (PTY) session in real-time.
Get all pending question requests across all sessions.

post.description: Reject a question request from the AI assistant.
Provide answers to a question request from the AI assistant.

answers.description: User answers in order of questions (each answer is an array of selected labels)

get.description: Get a list of all OpenCode sessions, sorted by most recently updated.

parameters.description: Filter sessions updated on or after this timestamp (milliseconds since epoch)
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Maximum number of sessions to return
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Create a new OpenCode session for interacting with AI assistants and managing conversations.

get.description: Retrieve the current status of all sessions, including active, idle, and completed states.

delete.description: Delete a session and permanently remove all associated data, including messages and history.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific OpenCode session.

patch.description: Update properties of an existing session, such as title or other metadata.

post.description: Abort an active session and stop any ongoing AI processing or command execution.

get.description: Retrieve all child sessions that were forked from the specified parent session.

post.description: Send a new command to a session for execution by the AI assistant.

get.description: Get the file changes (diff) that resulted from a specific user message in the session.

post.description: Create a new session by forking an existing session at a specific message point.
Analyze the current application and create an AGENTS.md file with project-specific agent configurations.

get.description: Retrieve all messages in a session, including user prompts and AI responses.

post.description: Create and send a new message to a session, streaming the AI response.

tools.description: @deprecated tools and permissions have been merged, you can set permissions on the session itself now

get.description: Retrieve a specific message from a session by its message ID.

delete.description: Delete a part from a message

patch.description: Update a part in a message

post.description: Approve or deny a permission request from the AI assistant.
Create and send a new message to a session asynchronously, starting the session if needed and returning immediately.

tools.description: @deprecated tools and permissions have been merged, you can set permissions on the session itself now

post.description: Revert a specific message in a session, undoing its effects and restoring the previous state.

delete.description: Remove the shareable link for a session, making it private again.

post.description: Create a shareable link for a session, allowing others to view the conversation.
Execute a shell command within the session context and return the AI's response.
Generate a concise summary of the session using AI compaction to preserve key information.

get.description: Retrieve the todo list associated with a specific session, showing tasks and action items.

post.description: Restore all previously reverted messages in a session.

get.description: Get a list of all available skills in the OpenCode system.

post.description: Append prompt to the TUI
Clear the prompt

get.description: Retrieve the next TUI (Terminal User Interface) request from the queue for processing.

post.description: Submit a response to the TUI request queue to complete a pending request.
Execute a TUI command (e.g. agent_cycle)
Open the help dialog in the TUI to display user assistance information.
Open the model dialog
Open the session dialog
Open the theme dialog
Publish a TUI event
Navigate the TUI to display the specified session.
Show a toast notification in the TUI
Submit the prompt

get.description: Retrieve version control system (VCS) information for the current project, such as git branch.
